body:
I'm sorry, I don't quite understand.

If you have 30,000 TCP clients, I would expect the memory to grow over time as new clients connect. Go will release memory back to the operating system slowly over time, if the memory usage has been low for some time. (for example, after the TCP clients are gone, but not immediately after)

But unless there's a bug here (and we'd need concrete details), please take general questions to a forum: https://golang.org/wiki/Questions
